messages: b02e405e228b636cf80b3a25f5804d24 (18:29): thanks for all help - bye !
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:38): i'm making qt4 packages for my distro
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:38): i am supposed to split the docs+examples section and the qtlibs section
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:38): is it ok to edit the projects.pro file
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:38): or is there a better way ?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:44): shastry: ./configure -help
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:44): -examplesdir... etc
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:45): if you really want to install them in different locations
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:45): ... presuming you could then separately make a package for them
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:47): emm no i cant do like that here
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:47): in one build.. i need them disabled
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:48): and in a separate build, i want the sources to be disabled and examples+docs to be enabled
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:49): I don't think that'll work out so great unless you have package like "qt-libs" "qt-libs-and-docs" versus "qt-libs" and "qt-docs"
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:49): e.g., QLibraryInfo wouldn't like it..
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:50): probably cause other problems...
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:50): just a random thought.. could also be worthless... but what if you just compiled the whole thing then carved it up into packages?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:51): just 'mv' the directories out you don't want...
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:51): yeah i'll do that
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:51): .. or make subtargets
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:51): like make sub-src
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:51): i think i'll bundle the examples with the libs
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (18:51): just look in the Makefile after you configure for the subtargets..
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:51): i just saw that some example thingy provides libarthurplugin

16fd5ef3687521c0339b0ce1c839c1b3 (18:57): mmm .... I was thinking about to make three classes to abstract data access using qt, so ... which would be the best approach ? a superclass which do db connection ? or db connection on each class ?
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:57): ah its a demo .. not example
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:57): i guess i can safely disable demo and exmaples
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:59): i meant docs and exmaples
4398b0e63edbef4d786f2387aa2f6f55 (18:59): examples*
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (19:01): doc__: what's wrong with the QtSql module?
16fd5ef3687521c0339b0ce1c839c1b3 (19:03): blockd: nothing wrong, simply a design issue :)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (19:03): so instead of using what's provided already, you want to redesign it?
16fd5ef3687521c0339b0ce1c839c1b3 (19:03): blockd: nope
16fd5ef3687521c0339b0ce1c839c1b3 (19:03): blockd: I'd like to know the best way to share a db connector from different classes
16fd5ef3687521c0339b0ce1c839c1b3 (19:04): blockd: so... a super class which make connection ? or open a connection on each class ?
16fd5ef3687521c0339b0ce1c839c1b3 (19:04): blockd: theses classes will share the db conection :)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (19:05): it's a pretty vage scenario though
16fd5ef3687521c0339b0ce1c839c1b3 (19:06): really, to optimice resources...
e8d02d72bee77f86138ae3caa93f5e4b (19:11): nuge: http://www.ogre3d.org/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=2750

cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (19:11): doc__: You can share a single connection as long as they're on the same thread. QSqlDatabase::database() is static, so once it's open, any function in any class can reference it.
